Changing Your Password

You can change the password assigned to you by the Administrator at any time. The password you change is the one that you entered in the Login dialog box. After you change it, your old password no longer works, and you must use the new password.

To change your password, you must first know what it is. If you forget your password, ask your Administrator to change it for you.

To change your password:

  1. Select File | Change Password. The Change Password dialog box appears.

  2. Enter your current password in the Old Password field, or leave the field blank if your user ID does not have a password.

  3. Enter your new password in the New Password field. As you type, the characters are displayed as asterisks. Your password can be up to 30 characters long.

  4. Re-enter your new password in the Verify field.

  5. Click OK.

Your password is updated and will take effect the next time you log in to Version Manager. Note that Version Manager passwords are case sensitive.
